qas.question: What chemistry do hydrides serve as bridging ligands?
What do hydrides that are bridging ligands link up?
What group is briging ligands most common in?

context: In <a0_0>inorganic chemistry<a0_0/>, hydrides can also serve as bridging ligands that <a1_0>link two metal centers<a1_0/> in a coordination complex. This function is particularly common in <a2_0>group 13<a2_0/> elements, especially in boranes (boron hydrides) and aluminium complexes, as well as in clustered carboranes.
